issues.description: The Person.getBirthday() accessor in the template repository returns String (public String getBirthday()) while PersonService.save(...) calls person.getBirthday().isAfter(LocalDate.now()), which requires getBirthday() to return a LocalDate. This causes a method return-type mismatch that will produce a compile-time error and prevents students from running tests or implementing service logic. The solution repository corrects this by making getBirthday() return LocalDate. Students will be blocked/confused because the template's Person API does not match how the model is used in the service and in the tests (which set the birthday using LocalDate).
issues.suggested_fix: Change the Person.getBirthday() method in the template to return a LocalDate (public LocalDate getBirthday()) and return the birthday field directly (return birthday;). This aligns the model API with PersonService.save(...) and the tests. Ensure JSON (de)serialization still works by keeping the registered Jackson modules (as in EistHerokuConfiguration).

issues.description: The Person::getBirthday accessor is inconsistently typed across artifacts. In the template repository Person.getBirthday() is declared to return String (returning birthday.toString()), while the PersonService.save(...) method and the unit/integration tests treat the birthday as a LocalDate (calling person.getBirthday().isAfter(LocalDate.now()) and using setBirthday(LocalDate.now())). The solution repository uses a LocalDate-returning getter. This mismatch makes it unclear to students whether the 'birthday' concept is a LocalDate or a serialized String, and it will cause compilation/type errors when students try to run or extend the template code.
issues.suggested_fix: Make the representation of 'birthday' consistent by changing the template Person.getBirthday() to return a LocalDate (matching the field type and usage in service/tests). For example: public LocalDate getBirthday() { return birthday; } This aligns template, tests, and the solution and removes the type/confusion barrier.
